title: Urban Insitute Employees Union
text:
Contact Us

General Questions?
Email us at urbaninstituteunion@gmail.com.


Specific concerns?
If you are an employee and have specific concerns about working conditions or would like to request a union rep for a meeting, please fill out the intake form and we will reach out. Or you can reach out directly to the Union stewards who are listed below via email or Slack.

title: Urban Insitute Employees Union
text: We are the Urban Institute Employees Union and represent over 250 employees at the Urban Institute. We are a proud member of the Non Profit Employees Union (NPEU). ‚úäüèæ

title: Urban Insitute Employees Union
text:
Free Swag

If you‚Äôre a member of the Union, you can get a free t-shirt and button from NPEU! Visit the NPEU website and use a discount code (reach out to a member of the BC for the code) to get one t-shirt and two buttons at no cost. When you receive your swag, feel free to post a selfie on social media, tag @NonprofitUnion and @UrbanInst_Union and use the hashtag #SolidarityForGood.

title: Urban Insitute Employees Union
text:
We, the employees of the Urban Institute, believe strongly in its promise of a workplace where ‚Äúall staff feel respected, heard, engaged, and valued‚Äù. Our union is motivated both by our commitment to Urban‚Äôs mission of bringing rigorous research to policy debates and by our commitment to improving Urban by ensuring it is an inclusive and nurturing workplace for all employees. We believe that nobody can represent workers‚Äô interests better than workers themselves and that our perspectives are vital to Urban‚Äôs longevity and its institutional ethics. And we believe that until we unite to strengthen our voices and decisionmaking power in conversation with management, Urban cannot make good on the workplace it promises.
As a union we commit to centering and supporting our Black, Brown, Indigenous, and Latinx colleagues; our queer and trans colleagues; and our colleagues with disabilities. We commit to being intentional about racial progress in performing our work, promoting a culture in which everyone is welcome to bring their full selves into work, and fighting for each other‚Äôs well-being through equitable pay, treatment, promotion processes, leadership, and mental health resources at Urban.
Together we will:

Create Accountable Treatment and Compensation Structures
Promote Transparency in Institutional Decisionmaking
Prioritize Diversity and Inclusion
Develop More Equitable Partnerships with Communities
Boost Morale

title: Urban Insitute Employees Union
text:
Bargaining Committee
Our union is represented by a 12 person Bargaining Committee (BC) listed below. We are in charge of communicating with management and negotiating our first Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA). Please feel free to get in touch with us via Slack or email.
